title: THE FISH AUCTION
style_prefix: Children's book illustration, warm painterly style with soft brush strokes. NO TEXT IN IMAGE.

character_refs.layla: Layla - girl with curly dark brown hair, yellow bow on top, teal hoodie with golden sun design
character_refs.riley: Riley - girl with straight dark hair, pink bow, purple dress with white stars
character_refs.ellis: Ellis - boy with blonde hair, blue eyes, orange and blue soccer jersey
character_refs.benny: Benny - friendly brown teddy bear character wearing green plaid scarf
character_refs.mr_mason: Mr. Mason - elderly African American man with gray hair, glasses, blue cardigan
character_refs.young_mr_mason: Young Mr. Mason - young African American man in his 20s with dark hair, simple traveling clothes

scenes.script: Mr. Mason looked in the trunk. He found a small wooden fish. It was pretty. 'This is from Japan,' he said. 'Have you ever heard of an auction?'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason in attic holding up a small carved wooden fish from the trunk. Friends watching with curiosity. Warm attic light.

scenes.script: The attic started to fade. Now they could see a big building. It was a fish market. It was very early in the morning. The sky was still dark outside.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition - attic fading into enormous Japanese fish market building. Pre-dawn darkness outside, bright lights inside. Industrial maritime setting.

scenes.script: Young Mr. Mason walked into the market. He saw huge fish on the floor. They were giant tuna! Some were bigger than him.
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason entering Tsukiji-style fish market. Giant bluefin tuna laid out on floor. Enormous fish, some bigger than a person. Wide-eyed amazement.

scenes.script: He found a special area. Many people stood around the fish. They wore special hats. A bell rang. Everyone got quiet.
scenes.prompt: Auction area in fish market. Buyers in work clothes and special numbered hats gathered around premium tuna. Bell visible. Anticipation.

scenes.script: A man stood up front. He was the auctioneer. He talked very fast in Japanese. Young Mr. Mason did not know the words. But he watched the buyers.
scenes.prompt: Auctioneer at front speaking rapidly with hand gestures. Young Mr. Mason watching intently, trying to understand. Buyers focused on auctioneer.

scenes.script: Hands went up. Fingers showed numbers. The buyers were bidding. They all wanted the same fish! They were trying to win.
scenes.prompt: Buyers raising hands with finger signals for bids. Competitive energy. Multiple people bidding on same fish. Intense auction action.

scenes.script: Two buyers really wanted one fish. They kept bidding higher. The price went up and up. Young Mr. Mason was amazed.
scenes.prompt: Two determined buyers in bidding war, going back and forth. Young Mr. Mason watching with amazement. Tension building. Price climbing.

scenes.script: One buyer finally won. The other one stopped. A bell rang. The winner bowed. The fish got a special mark.
scenes.prompt: Winning buyer bowing as bell rings. Other buyer stepping back graciously. Worker marking the sold tuna. Moment of victory.

scenes.script: Young Mr. Mason talked to a buyer. 'Who decides the price?' he asked. The man laughed. 'We do!' he said. 'The buyers decide.'
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason in conversation with friendly Japanese buyer. Buyer gesturing and explaining with a smile. Learning moment.

scenes.script: The buyer explained more. 'In an auction, buyers fight with prices. Whoever wants it most pays the most.'
scenes.prompt: Buyer continuing to explain auction concept to young Mr. Mason. Both near giant tuna. Educational exchange.

scenes.script: Young Mr. Mason looked around the market. He saw it now. When many people want something, the price goes up.
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason surveying the busy fish market with new understanding. Light bulb moment. Seeing the economics in action.

scenes.script: He found a small shop. They sold little carved fish. He bought a wooden fish to remember today.
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason at small souvenir shop with carved wooden fish displayed. Selecting one special carved fish to buy. Keepsake moment.

scenes.script: The fish market started to fade. The colors got soft. They were back in the attic. Mr. Mason still held the wooden fish.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition back - fish market fading. Attic returning. Old Mr. Mason now, holding the same wooden fish from the memory.

scenes.script: The friends were amazed. 'So when lots of people want something, the price goes up?' asked Benny. 'Exactly!' said Mr. Mason.
scenes.prompt: Friends looking amazed, Benny asking question with curious expression. Mr. Mason nodding approvingly, placing wooden fish back in trunk.

scenes.script: Ellis spoke up. 'Wait! That's the opposite of the lemonade!' Everyone looked at him. 'We had too many sellers. At the auction, there were too many buyers.'
scenes.prompt: Ellis having realization moment, connecting ideas. Other friends and Mr. Mason turning to look at him with interest. Breakthrough moment.

scenes.script: The friends stared at Ellis. 'That's so smart,' said Layla. 'You are good at figuring things out.' Ellis smiled. He felt proud.
scenes.prompt: Ellis beaming with pride as friends compliment his thinking. Layla speaking admiringly. Ellis gaining confidence. Warm moment.

scenes.script: 'Could we have an auction?' asked Riley. 'At our market?' The friends got excited. 'People could bid on special things!'
scenes.prompt: Riley suggesting idea with excitement. All four friends animated and excited about auction idea for their market. Brainstorming energy.

scenes.script: Ellis took out a small notebook. He wrote down the idea. 'An auction,' he said. 'And fair prices.' He was keeping track.
scenes.prompt: Ellis with small notebook, writing down ideas. Organized and methodical. Other friends watching approvingly. Taking notes on learnings.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason smiled at them. 'There are more things in this trunk,' he said. 'More stories from markets around the world. Italy. Germany.'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason gesturing to the trunk with more treasures inside. Friends leaning in eagerly. Promise of more stories. Anticipation.

scenes.script: The friends could not wait. Every story was teaching them something. They would use these lessons for their Community Market.
scenes.prompt: Four friends gathered around trunk with Mr. Mason, excited and engaged. Ready to learn more. Building toward their own market.
